summary: Artist marketplace platform for creators to list and sell original works (songs, videos, images, 3D prints, ceramics, paintings, etc.) with multi-photo uploads, auto-generated descriptions, Stripe payments (10% platform fee), and admin configuration controls
architectural_notes: Stripe integration required for payment processing
Platform fee structure: 10% on all transactions
Multi-media support needed (images, videos, audio, 3D files)
File upload system must handle multiple photos per listing
Admin dashboard for configuration and branding customization
Artist profile creation required before users can post items or configure payment settings
known_issues: Item posting fails with 'user not found' error - authentication/user lookup issue preventing listing creation

existing_features.title: Create an item listing creation flow where creators can upload multiple photos, select a category, set a price, and submit for auto-generated description
Implement auto-generated item descriptions using a placeholder generation function, with full editing capability allowing creators to modify the generated text before saving
Integrate Stripe payment processing for item purchases, automatically calculating and applying a 10% platform fee on each transaction
Create admin dashboard with controls for platform branding (name, logo, colors) and configuration settings (fee percentage, featured items)
Build a marketplace browse page displaying all listed items in a grid layout with photos, titles, prices, and category filters
Create item detail page showing all uploaded photos in a gallery, full description, price, creator info, and purchase button
Design a creative, artisan-focused visual theme with warm, earthy tones and elegant typography that conveys craftsmanship and authenticity, applying it consistently across all pages
Verify that the CreateItemForm component properly handles authentication state and displays appropriate error messages if user lookup fails
Add an 'Artist Profile' or 'Settings' navigation item in the Header component that is visible to authenticated users, linking to a new settings page route
Create a new Settings page route (/settings) that displays artist profile configuration options including the ability to enable artist mode and configure Stripe payment settings

Update the CreateItemForm component to check that the authenticated user has artist status (isArtist = true) before allowing item creation, displaying an appropriate message if the user is not an artist
Move the Stripe configuration interface from the admin-only AdminPage to the new Settings page, allowing individual artists to configure their own Stripe payment settings for receiving payments
Create a React Query hook for fetching and updating the current user's artist status, enabling the Settings page to display and toggle artist mode

new_feature_requests.summary: Item listing system with multiple photo uploads
Auto-generate item descriptions with full editing capability
Stripe payment integration with 10% platform fee
Admin controls for branding and configuration
Support for multiple item types (songs, videos, images, 3D prints, ceramics, paintings)

Create a data model for marketplace items supporting multiple categories (songs, videos, images, 3D prints, ceramics, paintings) with fields for title, description, price, category, creator ID, and creation timestamp
Implement backend storage for multiple photo uploads per item, storing image data as blobs with references to parent items
Debug and fix the 'user not found' error that occurs when authenticated users attempt to create item listings, ensuring that user profile lookup or creation succeeds before allowing item creation
Create artist profile in settings to enable item posting and Stripe payment configuration
Add an 'isArtist' boolean field to the User type in the backend data model to track whether a user has artist privileges for posting items
Create a backend mutation to update a user's artist status (isArtist field), allowing users to enable or disable artist mode from their profile settings
Update the backend Stripe configuration storage to be user-scoped rather than platform-wide, allowing each artist to maintain their own Stripe settings for receiving payments on their sold items
